result.execSummary:
The defendant Lamontrez D Haywood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 90 days.  Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with fine payments.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lamontrez D Haywood

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

10:36 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Defendant Lamontrez D Haywood in court. 

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defendant as it relates to his waiver of right to an attorney.
The Defendant wishes to waive his right to an attorney.
The Court finds that the Defendant is freely, knowingly, and voluntarily waiving his right to an attorney.

The Court conducts a plea colloquy with the Defendant.
The Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1.
The Court finds the Defendant guilty of Count 1.

The State gives its sentencing recommendation.


Court orders the following:
	
Fine:  $316.00
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Payment of Fine/Forfeiture/Costs/Surcharges:  To be paid in 90 days.  Civil judgment to be entered as penalty for non payment.

HOW TO PAY:
Payments can be made on-line with a MasterCard or electronic check at:  http://wcca.wicourts.gov  (Read the agreement, then click "I agree," then click "Pay fees on-line.")  OR you may contact the Waukesha County Clerk of Courts Business Center at 262-548-7497.

2:15 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary Caitlin Brejcha in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lamontrez D Haywood in court. 

The Defendant requests to see if he qualifies for SPD representation.
The Court will adjourn the matter.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Pre-trial conference on August 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

09:54 AM Defendant Lamontrez D Haywood in court.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
